heading: rants & raves
author: wired staff
text: __ rants & __ the five-year glitch __this has not been "the brilliance of present technology only highlights the continued tragedy warned by goethe: where the light is brightest, the shadows are darkest. having missed the industrial revolution, developing countries will be hopelessly unable to catch up with the perpetual accelerations of moore's law.timothy l. jenkinstjenkins@charm.net__ the african century __the continent isn't wired, for several reasons, including inefficient government monopolies and an immense debt burden. most solutions to these problems originate outside the continent. the history of modern africa is littered with attempts by westerners to introduce technologies: tractors, new seed varieties, giant dams. the problem has less to do with wiring the continent, and more to do with establishing a critical mass of expertise so that africans can address their own technological, social, economic, and political problems and opportunities. we need to invest in people just as much as we need to invest in wires and chips.james deanepanos@gn.apc.org__ freeman, free markets __cristy o'keefecrisokeefe@aol.com__ way new old-fart journalism __however, the old-fart journalist in me remains sentimentally attached to a more old-fashioned truth. here's an idea to unite the old with the new: take several thousand journalists. hire them part-time - just a few hours a week - to cover the narrowest beats possible: polyvinyl chloride pricing in japan, the 46th precinct police blotter in new york, the daily death list in ames, iowa. pay them in shares of the enterprise according to how frequently their items are read. cobble up a little agent software to organize the stuff they churn out, and deliver it directly to the users who want it.thomas petzinger jr.tom@petzinger.com__ fetishism __james stewartj.k.stewart@ed.ac.uk__ it's the embargo, stupid __jonathan colvinjcolvin@ican.net__ for skin __the circumcising of baby boys in the us is commonly performed without anesthesia while the defenseless babies are tied down and screaming in pain. it is well established that circumcision is not necessary, yet the practice continues throughout the world.john mccabethejmccabe@aol.com__ playtime __william l. klaber jr.klaberw@isoc.net__ style counsel __rebecca o'malleyhappybecca@email.msn.com__ undo __send your rants & raves to:email: snail mail: wired, po box 191826 san francisco, ca 94109-9866editorial guidelines: editorial correspondence:
